revised_title: Investigating the Expansion and Contraction of Timber in Different Directions Relative to the Position of the Medulla of the Tree
tldr: Thomas Andrew Knight investigates the expansion and contraction of timber in different directions relative to the position of the medulla of the tree. He discovers that the force of the cellular substance in timber is strong enough to cause rifts or clefts in trees and suggests that this force is responsible for the movement of sap in living trees.
